comment: If you take him for BPS, you should receive an A. Literally when it comes to completing homework and studying for midterms, just do whatever he says. Literally. Word for word. He is a little corny, but in a funny way.
Dr. Efosa cares about his students and he is always ready to work with you if you have academics or personal problems.
Dr. Idemudia is an expert in Data Mining and Business Intelligence because you learn how to use data to make decisions.
Dr. Idemudia is a very caring professor and he is always in his office. His exams are very easy and they are open books and notes.
The class is very easy…If you do and submit all assignments, projects, and exams the worst grade you will have is a B+. Dr. Idemudia does not accept late assignments.

Oh’ I wish Dr. Idemudia was the one you taught me programming class. I enjoyed his class a lot and I learned how to program using html to develop webpages. You will do well in his class if you submit all assignments before deadlines. He does not accept late assignments and some students are not happy.
All of his reviews are written by himself. Do not believe them. He is the worst professor I have ever had and I have had some bad ones. I could learn more cleaning out a toilet.
I enjoyed the class because Dr. Idemudia makes complex concepts simple.
Dr. Idemudia did a good job explaining HTML, Excel, Access to over hundred students…Exams are open book and the class size is very large, more than hundred students.
I like Dr. Idemudia because he has open door policy and all students have his cell phone number. The exams are open books and notes.
I recommend this course because you learn a lot by helping companies to develop web pages. All assignments and exams are open books/notes. All students have the instructor cell phone number.
I enjoyed the web development class and I am now helping companies to develop web pages. Dr. Idemudia does not accept late projects without a valid excuse. The exams are open notes and textbooks.

Dr. Idemudia believes in all students potentials; what I do not like is that the class size exceeds over hundred students. It is difficult to teach HTML, MS Excel, and technical concepts to over hundred students at the same time.
Stay away from this guy at any level ... you've been warned.
The professor did a good job explaining HTML, MS Word, Excel etc to over hundred students. I know teaching technical materials to over hundred student is not easy.

It wasn't a hard class, but I would not label it as easy.  I went in knowing nothing about information systems, and left with the same knowledge. It's hard to understand him, and the notes in class aren't really helpful in tests or in class assignments.
I enjoyed the class because I learned MS Word, Excel, and HTML. The class was very challenging because there were over hundred students in the class.
Dr. idemudia has passion for students to learn because students have his cell phone number and he has open door policy.

I did well in the class because Dr. Idemudia was always in his office during office hours. Also, he gave his cell phone number for students to call if they have any questions. He has open door policy.

The course is extremely useful to me because I can now develop web sites/pages, professional resume, cover letter, comfortably use MS Excel etc. I know some students are not happy because Dr. Idemudia did not accept their late assignments. Also, Dr. Idemudia did not curve in the final examsâ??luckily I had an A.

He cares more about group project than what you learn as an individual. Midterms and finals are open book, but are so inconsistent. If you have ANY questions, he refuse to answer it in class- He makes you go to his office. I would avoid his class if possible. You don't learn anything, and it is pointless.
In person Dr. Idemudia is a very good person and he is not a bad professor. When I had a medical problem he worked with me personally even though the class size was very large.

I usually don't rate my professor or whatever but I have to for him. This guy is seriously the worse. I learned nothing. He couldn't operate the  room technology properly. This guy has a degree in IS? really? If that's true then he definitely made IS majors look bad. He also tells us to his office instead of answering a simple question in class.

This is the worst professor I've ever had in my life... I am about to graduate college and this IS class was mandatory. DO NOT take him... You will learn nothing and be completely frustrated in class by his constant interruptions. If you want to listen to someone blabber, take him. If you actually want to learn, don't.

He is not a very good teacher, some of the reviews on this site are his I can tell by his grammar. I would not recommend him to anyone, his exams are IMPOSSIBLE are he offers very little help to his students. avoid him at all costs

Prof. Idemudia, is probably the worst professor in KSU. You will NOT LEARN ANYTHING!!!! Always wants you to see him in his office for the simplest question. Makes assignments difficult then it really is. Avoid this professor take Marques instead. I always attended class and did not understand anything all semester. Avoid him TRUST ME!!!

Very rude and disrespectful.  His assignments were relatively easy, as long as you didn't rely on him for instructions...I pity anyone who didn't know HTML before this class because they must've been completely lost.  He finds the most complicated way to explain everything.

I would not recommend him. I post a review and it gets deleted every time. These reviews are obviously written by Idemudia himself. I had to drop the class, and so did many others. He yelled at me on the phone and treated students badly in class.

Be prepared to think with this class. It is possible to come out with an "A" only if you are willing to do the work. I actually enjoyed taking this class I love learning about Data Mining. If you are willing to do the work, I recommend anybody to take Data Mining. You will not regret it.
I recommend Dr. Idemudia because he is very hardworking and caring. Dr. Idemudia gives daily homework, hence it is mandatory for students to prepare for classes daily.

Professor Idemudia's class is very easy.  The tests are based on a curve and are open book/internet (buy the ebook) and the projects are not difficult.  That said, the class is utterly useless. He is never organized, the tests do not at all cover what is taught in class, and he does not know the material. Choose someone else if you're an IS major.

Pick another prof. VERY repetitive, hard to understand (thick accent) with snoozefest lectures, & he takes roll after class. Grading process very inconsistent. Excel project on material not taught in class & exams worded a little difficult. Does try to help students though. Have an A so far, haven't learned anything... "Does this make sense?"

Not a bad prof. Cares about his students. His lectures are ridiculously boring. He posts ppts online. You do alot of group work, so chose wisely. He gives group homework everyday and he calls on EVERY group. All tests are online and you can use the internet, book, and notes. He curves tests. Overall not a bad class.

Dr. Idemudia is an expert in web development; class attendance is mandatory because points are assigned to daily class exercises. Hence, some students do not like his web development class because of daily class exercises. It is impossible to have an A in his class if you do not attend classes regularly.  Also, the homework is difficult.
Attendance is mandatory and I did not like that. Also, the professor is very friendly and humbly..

As students, we can expect exactly ZERO slack or forgiveness for failing any of the assignments, projects, or tests. So why do the rules apply differently to a course prof as they do here? Clearly this one is not qualified. It's BS. Oh well, I guess you're just going to be fed whatever so this institution can acquire your tuition money.Fair warning

I really enjoy the class. The professor is extremely helpful and really cares for his students. He always goes out of his way to make sure everyone is on the same page. I highly recommend Efosa Idemudia. I wish he would teach a Java or C# class because he really explains it in a way that sticks your head!
"I do not understand anything and if the instructor is not replaced with one who actually knows the material, I plan to leave by march 12th."
the instructor is probably a good guy, but how he got the job, i have no clue.
